boofcv.alg.feature.detect.chess
Class DetectChessCalibrationPoints<T extends ImageSingleBand,D extends ImageSingleBand>

java.lang.Object
  boofcv.alg.feature.detect.chess.DetectChessCalibrationPoints<T,D>

public class DetectChessCalibrationPoints<T extends ImageSingleBand,D extends ImageSingleBand>
extends java.lang.Object

Detects calibration points inside a chessboard calibration target. A crude approximation of the chess board is found by thresholding the image dynamically. Once found corner points are detected and pruned. The remaining points are computed to sub-pixel accuracy by fitting a 2D quadratic to feature intensity in a 3x3 region.

The found control points are ensured to be returned in a row-major format with the correct number of rows and columns, with a counter clockwise ordering. Note that when viewed on the monitor this will appear to be clockwise because the y-axis points down.

Author:
Peter Abeles

Constructor Detail

DetectChessCalibrationPoints

public DetectChessCalibrationPoints(int numCols,
                                    int numRows,
                                    int radius,
                                    int maxAttempts,
                                    double maxPixelValue,
                                    java.lang.Class<T> imageType)
Configures detection parameters

Parameters:
numCols - Number of columns in square block grid. Target dependent.
numRows - Number of rows in square block grid. Target dependent.
radius - Side of interest point detection region. Typically 5
maxAttempts - Maximum number of different threshold it will try to detect the image
maxPixelValue - Maximum pixel intensity value. Almost always 255
imageType - Type of image being processed
